alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 2:35PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Brief landspout tornadoes possible... Conditions will be favorable for the development of landspout tornadoes in eastern Douglas, northwest Elbert, and central Arapahoe counties over the next couple of hours. At this time, it is unkown which if any storm would produce a landspout. Any landspouts that develop are expected to pose a limited threat. HAZARD...Landspouts possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Castle Rock, Bennett, Elizabeth, Larkspur, Ponderosa Park, Franktown, The Pinery and Strasburg. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Denver Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
